meanings.definition: Rejecting all religious and moral principles, often in the belief that life is meaningless.
meanings.sent1: He had a nihilistic outlook, thinking life had no purpose.
meanings.sent2: The character in the movie had a nihilistic attitude towards society.
meanings.sent3: The nihilistic cat refused to believe in the existence of catnip.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings reflected a nihilistic view of beauty, using only dark colors.
meanings.sent5: The stormy sky matched his nihilistic mood, devoid of hope.

meanings.sent1: The book explored the nihilistic philosophy of the main character.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lecture delved into the nihilistic themes of the novel.
meanings.sent3: The nihilistic debate club argued for the absence of winners.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit had a nihilistic vibe, with all black clothing.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house had a nihilistic aura, echoing emptiness.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a belief in the negation of all moral values.
meanings.sent1: His actions were often seen as nihilistic, disregarding ethical norms.
meanings.sent2: The villain's nihilistic behavior shocked the community.
meanings.sent3: The nihilistic student skipped class to protest against rules.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist's work had a nihilistic message, challenging societal norms.
meanings.sent5: The barren land symbolized a nihilistic world, devoid of compassion.
